org.jpws.front.util

Class RecentList

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.swing.AbstractListModel
      • org.jpws.front.util.RecentList
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Iterable, java.util.EventListener, javax.swing.ComboBoxModel, javax.swing.event.MenuListener, javax.swing.ListModel
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    PwsFileSocket.PwsFileRecentList

    public class RecentList
extends javax.swing.AbstractListModel
implements javax.swing.ComboBoxModel, javax.swing.event.MenuListener, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Iterable
    Utility class to serve a recent file list for menus.

    The RecentList's maxvalue has a minimum of 0 and a default of 8.

    Author:
    Wolfgang Keller
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RecentList()
      Creates an empty RecentList with max entries of 8.

      Creates an empty RecentList with the specified max entries value.

      Creates an empty RecentList with the specified menu-item command socket and max entries.
      RecentList(java.lang.String command, int max, int displayed)
      Creates an empty RecentList with the specified menu-item command socket, max list entries and max entries in the menu.

        public RecentList(int max)
        Creates an empty RecentList with the specified max entries value.
        Parameters:
        max - maximum number of entries in this list

      • RecentList

        public RecentList(java.lang.String command)
        Creates an empty RecentList with the specified menu-item command socket. Max entries of 8.
        Parameters:
        command - the command socket which is used to address global ActionListener

      • RecentList

        public RecentList(java.lang.String command,
                  int max)
        Creates an empty RecentList with the specified menu-item command socket and max entries.
        Parameters:
        command - String the command socket which is used to address global ActionListener, may be null
        max - int maximum number of entries in this list

      • RecentList

        public RecentList(java.lang.String command,
                  int max,
                  int displayed)
        Creates an empty RecentList with the specified menu-item command socket, max list entries and max entries in the menu.
        Parameters:
        command - the command socket which is used to address global ActionListener
        max - maximum number of entries in this list
        displayed - maximum number of entries which are taken into menu display
        Since:
        0-5-0

      • setContent

        public void setContent(java.lang.String list)
        Sets the content of this RecentList through a semicolon separated list of text values. The values may be encoded according to CSV rules (rfc-4180).
        Parameters:
        list - sequence of semicolon separated text values (CSV encoded)

      • setMenuFinalItem

        public void setMenuFinalItem(javax.swing.JMenuItem item)
        If not null the menu item specified here is shown as last element, separated by a separator line, when this recent list is used as a menu generator.
        Parameters:
        item - JMenuItem
        Since:
        0-5-0

      • setMenuFinalItem

        public void setMenuFinalItem(java.awt.MenuItem item)
        If not null the menu item specified here is shown as last element, separated by a separator line, when this recent list is used as a menu generator.
        Parameters:
        item - JMenuItem
        Since:
        0-5-0

      • getStringContent

        public java.lang.String getStringContent()
        Returns a String value representing the content of this RecentList as a semicolon separated concatenation of "toString()" values of the listed objects. This value may be used for persistent storage and is encoded according to rfc-4180.
        Returns:
        String content value

      • getContent

        public java.lang.Object[] getContent()
        Returns an array of objects containing all listed values of this RecentList.
        Returns:
        Object[]

      • toStringArray

        public java.lang.String[] toStringArray()
        Returns a String array representing all currently stored values of this RecentList in the order most recent to least recent. (The result utilizes the toString() property of the listed objects.)
        Returns:
        String[]

      • updateMenu

        public void updateMenu(javax.swing.JMenu menu)
        Updates the given JMenu with a list of all stored objects of this RecentList. The toString() property of objects is used to represent them.
        Parameters:
        menu -

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • getFirst

      • getStringValue

        public java.lang.String getStringValue(int index)
        Returns the text value of the object at position index or null if index is out of range. The text value is derived from the stored object's toString() method.
        Parameters:
        index - entry position in list
        Returns:
        entry text value

      • pushRecent

        public boolean pushRecent(java.lang.Object value)
        Inserts or re-arranges the specified object in this RecentList.
        Parameters:
        value - text value to be inserted/updated
        Returns:
        boolean true if and only if the content of recent list has been modified by this operation

      • replaceRecent

        public void replaceRecent(java.lang.Object oldObj,
                          java.lang.Object newObj)
        Replaces an entry in this recent list so that the new object is in the same list position as the old. Does nothing if oldObj is not present in the list.
        Parameters:
        oldObj - existing object (as per equals()) to be removed
        newObj - new object to be inserted
        Since:
        0-5-0

        public java.util.Iterator<?> iterator()
        Returns an iterator over all entry objects in this RecentList in proper sequence.

      • hasRecent

        public boolean hasRecent(java.lang.Object obj)
        Whether a given object is an element of this recent list. The equals() method is used to test identify.
        Parameters:
        obj - Object to be tested
        Returns:
        boolean true if and only if the parameter object equals an element of this recent list
        Since:
        0-6-0
